quotes.quote: The impulse to perform a worthy action often springs from our best nature, but is afterwards tainted by the spur of selfishness or sinister interest.
The comic impulse is sometimes a reaction to sadness. You feel like you can make one choice or the other.
The impulse to connect the dots - and to share what you've connected - is the urge that makes you an artist.
The impulse to travel is one of the hopeful symptoms of life.
Interesting things happen when the creative impulse is cultivated with curiosity, freedom and intensity.
When we are on the water, our contemplative impulses range from the intense to the nearly absent.
Vision gives you the impulse to make the picture your own.
We are rarely wrong when we act from impulse.
Character is the impulse reined down into steady continuance.
Let the first impulse pass, wait for the second.
The impulse to tell the truth was not as great as the fear of being left off the page.
The impulse of modern art is the desire to destroy beauty.
When the creative impulse sweeps over you, grab it. You grab it and honor it and use it, because momentum is a rare gift.
Your first impulse is to share good news, your second is to club someone with it.
Creativity is the evolutionary impulse in the Universe.
The impulse to pursue God originates with God, but the outworking of that impulse is our following hard after Him.
Choosing not to act on an angry impulse and to feel the pain that lies beneath it is a very courageous thing to do.
Mistrust first impulses; they are nearly always good.
The primary use of conversation is to satisfy the impulse to talk.
Giving is the vital impulse and moral center of capitalism.
The impulse to worship is impossible to eradicate. Even the most prosaic have to worship something.

One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.

The impulse to write things down is a peculiarly compulsive one, inexplicable to those who do not share it, useful only accidentally, only secondarily, in the way that any compulsion tries to justify itself.
Every impulse we strangle will only poison us.
Impulse without reason is not enough, and reason without impulse is a poor makeshift.
Distrust all in whom the impulse to punish is powerful.
The natural impulse of men is to follow and whoever has the strongest sense of purpose will always dominate.
The impulse to take life strivingly is indestructible in the race.
At the heart of the impulse to tell stories is a mystery so profound.
A first impulse was never a crime.
It is not enough to recognize what is right and true. One must control the impulse to do what is wrong and easy.
